There's a function in a popular R package that turns an R script
into an R Markdown document.
What is that function's name?

I [asked my twitter friends](https://twitter.com/grrrck/status/1527048719404830720)
and they said..

```{r}
survey <- data.frame(
  answer = c("spin()", "purl()", "rscript_to_rmd()", "ðŸ¤” I'm not sure"),
  n = c(96, 55, 52, 283 - 96 - 55 - 52)
)
ggplot(survey) +
  aes(n, answer) +
  geom_col() +
  theme_minimal(24, "Outfit")
```

:::


- https://github.com/richfitz/sowsear
  - sowsear: Make Silk (knitr files) from a sow's ear (an R script)
- In knitr it was originally called [silk()](https://github.com/yihui/knitr/commit/20d691148d0fd7de4ccd2809a307429e78f68f17)
  - `silk(input, knit = TRUE, format = "Rmd")`
